pullRequest.title: [cs] Update C# grammar for additional C# 7 and C# 8 features
pullRequest.bodyText:
Describe the PR
This updates the Antlr grammar that is used for C# with the changes that were made in the antlr/grammars-v4 repository.
This includes:

A fix for a case where empty commits were not tokenized correctly
Support for digit separators _ (C# 7.0)
Support for binary literals (C# 7.0)
Addition of the unmanaged keyword (C# 7.3)
Addition of the null-coalescing assignment operator ??= (C# 8.0)
Addition of the range operator .. (C# 8.0)
Addition of the nullable preprocessor directive nullable (C# 8.0)

Related issues
None that I'm aware of.
Ready?


 Added unit tests for fixed bug/feature
 Passing all unit tests
 Complete build ./mvnw clean verify passes (checked automatically by travis)
 Added (in-code) documentation (if needed)

commit.message: Update C# grammar for additional C# 7 and C# 8 features
Add tests for additional C# 7 and C# 8 features

nodes.bodyText: @maikelsteneker Thanks for adding tests! The one last thing I have reservation is this change, as it's not obvious to me what is fixed here. Was /***/ incorrectly tokenized previously? Maybe, add this to the test case and this should be gold.

commit.message:
Add test for empty C# comment.

This was previously incorrectly tokenized, because it was recognized as the start of a documentation comment.
